-- | API version <tt>2021-02-01</tt> of the Amazon Account SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The operation failed because one of the input parameters was invalid.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because the calling identity doesn't have the
--   minimum required permissions.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because it was called too frequently and exceeded
--   a throttle limit.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because of an error internal to Amazon Web
--   Services. Try your operation again later.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because it specified a resource that can't be
--   found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

--   Services account.

PutAlternateContact' :: Maybe Text -> AlternateContactType -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> PutAlternateContact

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
[$sel:accountId:PutAlternateContact'] :: PutAlternateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies which alternate contact you want to create or update.

-- | Deletes the specified alternate contact from an Amazon Web Services
--   account.
--   
--   For complete details about how to use the alternate contact
--   operations, see <a>Access or updating the alternate contacts</a>.
module Amazonka.Account.DeleteAlternateContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAlternateContact</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteAlternateContact
DeleteAlternateContact' :: Maybe Text -> AlternateContactType -> DeleteAlternateContact

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
[$sel:accountId:DeleteAlternateContact'] :: DeleteAlternateContact -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.
[$sel:alternateContactType:DeleteAlternateContact'] :: DeleteAlternateContact -> AlternateContactType

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteAlternateContact</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeleteAlternateContact'</a>,
--   <a>deleteAlternateContact_accountId</a> - Specifies the 12 digit
--   account ID number of the Amazon Web Services account that you want to
--   access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alternateContactType:DeleteAlternateContact'</a>,
--   <a>deleteAlternateContact_alternateContactType</a> - Specifies which
--   of the alternate contacts to delete.
newDeleteAlternateContact :: AlternateContactType -> DeleteAlternateContact

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
deleteAlternateContact_accountId :: Lens' DeleteAlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.
deleteAlternateContact_alternateContactType :: Lens' DeleteAlternateContact AlternateContactType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAlternateContactResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeleteAlternateContactResponse
DeleteAlternateContactResponse' :: DeleteAlternateContactResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteAlternateContactResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteAlternateContactResponse :: DeleteAlternateContactResponse

module Amazonka.Account.Lens

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
deleteAlternateContact_accountId :: Lens' DeleteAlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies which of the alternate contacts to delete.
deleteAlternateContact_alternateContactType :: Lens' DeleteAlternateContact AlternateContactType

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
putAlternateContact_accountId :: Lens' PutAlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies which alternate contact you want to create or update.
putAlternateContact_alternateContactType :: Lens' PutAlternateContact AlternateContactType

-- | Specifies an email address for the alternate contact.
putAlternateContact_emailAddress :: Lens' PutAlternateContact Text

-- | Specifies a name for the alternate contact.
putAlternateContact_name :: Lens' PutAlternateContact Text

-- | Specifies a phone number for the alternate contact.
putAlternateContact_phoneNumber :: Lens' PutAlternateContact Text

-- | Specifies a title for the alternate contact.
putAlternateContact_title :: Lens' PutAlternateContact Text

-- | Specifies the 12 digit account ID number of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that you want to access or modify with this operation.
--   
--   If you do not specify this parameter, it defaults to the Amazon Web
--   Services account of the identity used to call the operation.
--   
--   To use this parameter, the caller must be an identity in the
--   <a>organization's management account</a> or a delegated administrator
--   account, and the specified account ID must be a member account in the
--   same organization. The organization must have <a>all features
--   enabled</a>, and the organization must have <a>trusted access</a>
--   enabled for the Account Management service, and optionally a
--   <a>delegated admin</a> account assigned.
--   
--   The management account can't specify its own <tt>AccountId</tt>; it
--   must call the operation in standalone context by not including the
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> parameter.
--   
--   To call this operation on an account that is not a member of an
--   organization, then don't specify this parameter, and call the
--   operation using an identity belonging to the account whose contacts
--   you wish to retrieve or modify.
getAlternateContact_accountId :: Lens' GetAlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies which alternate contact you want to retrieve.
getAlternateContact_alternateContactType :: Lens' GetAlternateContact AlternateContactType

-- | A structure that contains the details for the specified alternate
--   contact.
getAlternateContactResponse_alternateContact :: Lens' GetAlternateContactResponse (Maybe AlternateContact)

-- | The response's http status code.
getAlternateContactResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetAlternateContactResponse Int

-- | The type of alternate contact.
alternateContact_alternateContactType :: Lens' AlternateContact (Maybe AlternateContactType)

-- | The phone number associated with this alternate contact.
alternateContact_phoneNumber :: Lens' AlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The name associated with this alternate contact.
alternateContact_name :: Lens' AlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address associated with this alternate contact.
alternateContact_emailAddress :: Lens' AlternateContact (Maybe Text)

-- | The title associated with this alternate contact.
alternateContact_title :: Lens' AlternateContact (Maybe Text)


module Amazonka.Account.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2021-02-01</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Operations for Amazon Web Services Account Management
module Amazonka.Account

-- | API version <tt>2021-02-01</tt> of the Amazon Account SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The operation failed because one of the input parameters was invalid.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because the calling identity doesn't have the
--   minimum required permissions.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because it was called too frequently and exceeded
--   a throttle limit.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because of an error internal to Amazon Web
--   Services. Try your operation again later.
_InternalServerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation failed because it specified a resource that can't be
--   found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAlternateContact</a> smart constructor.

AlternateContactType' :: Text -> AlternateContactType
[fromAlternateContactType] :: AlternateContactType -> Text
pattern AlternateContactType_BILLING :: AlternateContactType
pattern AlternateContactType_OPERATIONS :: AlternateContactType
pattern AlternateContactType_SECURITY :: AlternateContactType

-- | A structure that contains the details of an alternate contact
--   associated with an Amazon Web Services account
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlternateContact</a> smart constructor.
data AlternateContact
AlternateContact' :: Maybe AlternateContactType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AlternateContact

-- | Create a value of <a>AlternateContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.
